headline.main: CONGRESS BATTLE SHAPES ON EASING NEUTRALITY ACT; Roosevelt and Leaders Due to Decide Tomorrow on Move for Amendment or Repeal OPPONENTS PLAN PARLEY Connally on Radio Tonight -- Steps to Arm Ships and Drop Zone Bans Are Indicated NEUTRALITY FIGHT IS TAKING SHAPE

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept 28 -- Senator Tom Connally of Texas, chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, indicated today that the Administration would not push for amendment of the Neutrality Act until after the second Lease-Lend Bill is passed.
abstract: Roosevelt plans conf with Cong leaders; opponents plan conf; Connally indicates delay; Wash and Hyde Pk sources predict steps to arm ships and drop zone bans
snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept 28 -- Senator Tom Connally of Texas, chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, indicated today that the Administration would not push for amendment of the Neutrality Act until after the second Lease-Lend Bill is passed....

byline.original: By JAMES B. RESTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES
